headline: Chicken Parmesan
description: For the best chicken Parmesan, try Chef John's version that's pan-fried and then baked, delivering impressive results with a crispier crust than most recipes.

video.description: Discover the secret to Chef John’s perfect chicken parmesan.
video.name: How to Make Chicken Parmesan

name: Chicken Parmesan
recipeIngredient: salt and freshly ground black pepper to taste
1 cup panko bread crumbs, or more as needed
2 tablespoons all-purpose flour, or more if needed
0.5 cup olive oil for frying, or as needed
0.25 cup fresh mozzarella, cut into small cubes

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat an oven to 450 degrees F (230 degrees C).

Place chicken breasts between two sheets of heavy plastic (resealable freezer bags work well) on a solid, level surface. Firmly pound chicken with the smooth side of a meat mallet to a thickness of 1/2-inch.
Season chicken thoroughly with salt and pepper. Using a sifter or strainer; sprinkle flour over chicken breasts, evenly coating both sides
Beat eggs in a shallow bowl and set aside.
Mix bread crumbs and 1/2 cup Parmesan cheese in a separate bowl, set aside.
Dip a flour-coated chicken breast in beaten eggs. Transfer breast to the bread crumb mixture, pressing crumbs into both sides. Repeat for each breast. Let chicken rest for 10 to 15 minutes.

Heat 1/2 inch olive oil in a large skillet on medium-high heat until it begins to shimmer. Cook chicken in the hot oil until golden, about 2 minutes per side. The chicken will finish cooking in the oven.

Transfer chicken to a baking dish. Top each breast with 2 tablespoons tomato sauce. Layer each chicken breast with equal amounts of mozzarella cheese, fresh basil, and provolone cheese. Sprinkle remaining Parmesan over top and drizzle each with 1/2 teaspoon olive oil.

Bake in the preheated oven until cheese is browned and bubbly and chicken breasts are no longer pink in the center, 15 to 20 minutes. An instant-read thermometer inserted into the center should read at least 165 degrees F (74 degrees C).

review.reviewBody: Very good definitely recommend
Pretty easy to follow and turned out great. Only thing to me was the frying time was far shorter than 2 min's per side, but I might have had the burner a little too hot. First time frying.

We followed the recipe almost to the T. I didn't have provolone, but the real mozzarella was bomb. I also didn't have basil, or Italian seasonings, so I used parsley, garlic powder and oregano. We ran out of panko, and used regular breadcrumbs. Those pieces were still good just not as good. Slicing the breasts in half was a bit tricky. I eventually got the knack. A good sharp knife is a must. The ones I messed up on just got breaded and fried (nuggets). I think letting them rest 15 is key. (I learned something new) My husband and I used teamwork to make it because we made 2 large and 1 small pan. (For a family birthday dinner+leftovers) Served it with fresh tossed salad and fettuccine. We will definitely make it again!
This was EXCELLENT! However, I made way to much!! Can you freeze it??
Delicious. Was quite a few steps, but worth it.

I loved this recipe! I like the advice of not over-loading the chicken with sauce. I was out of a couple ingredients and so I replaced basil leaves with basil pesto and shredded sharp cheddar for provolone. Tasted great!

Crispy and delicious. I omitted the provolone cheese and basil. Came out so good my 2 year old ate it. (She never eats chicken that I make.) My husband adored it and said it was restaurant quality. 100% recommend this. A bit labor intensive but so worth it.
Super Easy!! Perfect for a Friday night!

I made this as written with less cooking oil, it was good and the chicken was moist. I'll add more parm/romano cheese to the breadcrumbs next time. I didn't salt my chicken due to the amount of sale in the parm/romano. I used pepper and garlic powder. Served with homemade sauce I had on hand with rotini pasta.
Crust was crispy and flavor perfect! Less tomato sauce was right on!

The is without a doubt the best recipe for parm that I have ever tried, and the only one I use now.Not putting any sauce under the chicken breasts, truly make a world of difference as to the crispness of the chicken. Recently, we moved to a rural area with many small farmers who grow their own poultry. Using fresh chicken breasts is a game changer for us.
very nice way to do chicken Parm

Wow! This is so crispy and delicious. Two things that really made a difference. Letting the chicken sit 15 min before frying and using freshly/off the block grated Parmesan cheese (so light). This will be on repeat and a go to for entertaining.

I love Chef John's recipes, so I was excited to give this one a try. I really didn't change anything, and I think the only issue I had was that the chicken breasts that I had were a little bit on the large side. Other than that, they turned out great. Thanks Chef John!!! This was the first thing made in the christening of my new gas range/oven in my newly remodeled kitchen...
Omg definitely the best ever chicken parm! Perfect perfect!
Absolutely Delicious!

This was superb. Crispy chicken and the flavors just popped. Will never eat this at a restaurant again. This recipe is absolutely delicious. a little time consuming but oh so worth it. definitely going to making this once a month.
My wife said, "Better than homemade from a restaurant!"
I think it would be helpful, given the high oven temp, to add an instruction to watch it closely the last 5 minutes. :-(

The amount of mozzarella is listed as 1/4 cup, yet the video shows much more than 1/4 cup cubed. Using 4 cups of bread crumbs is excessive and not needed. I used 2 and didn’t need all of it. Please correct the recipe so food isn’t wasted. Flavors were good overall.
I didn't follow the measurements suggested but, did everything else. Came out excellent. Love the 'dusting' rather than dredging.

Excellent w/excellent tips in the video. It was perfect for me. My husband has extra sauce on the side. Letting them sit breaded for 15 minutes makes a huge difference. Delicious. Made it exactly as recipe directed. 1st time making bc it always has way too much sauce & cheese in restaurants & it's a put off to me. Great recipe.

Made it tonight. It was excellent! Didn't have the romano as I forgot it at store. But fresh grated parmesan and mozzarella worked great. I fried and baked per instructions but brought the meat to temp before applying sauce and adding cheese so it would stay crispy. Also grated the mozz. Instead of cubing.

I made this recipe last night exactly as written and both my husband and sister raved about it. I also thought it was amazing. The tip about leaving the breaded chicken to sit on the counter for 15 minutes before cooking was soooo helpful! I've never had more success in keeping breading on a piece of chicken before. We all agreed that this recipe is going into the rotation. It took a bit of prep time but boy-oh-boy it was so worth it! I made a total of 8 big pieces of chicken so we would have leftovers and they warmed up very nicely in our air fryer the next day for lunch. 100% recommend.
Wonderful. Kids love it
This is a new favorite! Thank you so much, we will definitely be making this regularly!

I used about 1/2C grated parmesan, 1/2C panko, 1/2C Italian breadcrumbs. Left out the oil drizzle (no need, after frying it). Skipped the salt & pepper as a baseline for my 1st try; next time I don't think I'll skip them (or at least add some Kosher salt to the breading). Only added the basil for the last 5-7 minutes so it wouldn't burn. Didn't have any provolone, but used good quality mozzarella and nobody was the wiser (especially after liberally dusting with parmesan). 3 large breast halves, pounded out and cut in half. Plenty to serve 6 people with healthy appetites. It was a huge hit across the board, definitely adding this one to my rotation! This would also be good with red pepper flakes added, or maybe next time I can just try a spicy red sauce (I really like spicy stuff).
So easy and straightforward to make! I’ve cooked it 3 times now and success every time. Only one thing I must change is using egg (allergic) so substitute water and flaxseed.
Excellant recipe would not change anything. Maybe one, cut the breast meat in half after pounding, it is a lot of food.
After following Rebecca Do’s corrections, it is 5 star’s excellent!

6 grown men devoured 12 large pieces! So delicious and flavorful and as a working mother/ wife, I appreciate how quick and easy this was to make! Minor changes: I added McCormick garlic and Herb Seasoning before flouring, I used dried basil on sauce before I topped with Shredded mozzarella (Provolone slices under the sauce directly on chicken) and placed on wired baking rack/ pan vs baking casserole pan for extra crispness. Came out so juicy, tender and crispy. Absolutely delicious! ❤️
Great recipe. I used one of my favorite jar spaghetti sauces. Halved the recipe. Was just so delicious!
I have made this three times now, most recently for a party of 12. Everyone loves it, I even received compliments the following day. Just follow the directions and it comes out perfect every time.
Very goon

I first seasoned my meat with garlic powder, onion powder, seasoned salt, pepper and Mrs. Dash garlic and onion herbs. I took the advise from some of the other helpful reviews and used 1 cup of panko bread crumbs and 1 cup of Italian seasoned bread crumbs, and 1 cup of parmesan cheese. It took 1 egg for every 2 breasts. I skipped the flour (not needed). Covered with aluminum foil and baked in the oven for about 20 minutes, removed foil and added slices of mozerella, shredded italian cheese blend, parmesean cheese and sprinkled some italian seasoning and baked for another 5-8 minutes. My picky kids loved it!
Best recipe the chicken was very tender

Very good but I used boneless chicken thighs Hunts pasta sauce and fried chicken in a cast iron pan before baking it in the oven. Needs a bit more seasoning though so next time I'll be using Italian seasoning to the salt and pepper mixture
worked great tasted good- changed up a few items- used shredded cheese and also spaghetti sauce. Worth the try.
Really good recipe Thanks
Easy to follow instructions and absolutely amazing Chicken Parm. Adding this to our weeknight meal line up
This was easy and it was great!
Liked it alot. Used spaghetti sauce instead of tomato sauce
So simple and so delicious! This is my family's favorite meal!
It was so easy, tender, and full of flavor!!!!

This is fabulous! I add a thin slice of provolone over the buffalo mozzarella and Parmesan because I am a cheese wh*re. This is super simple, perfectly crispy, and a show stopper when cooking for a crowd. It’s also easy enough for a weeknight. I haven’t tried freezing the cutlets for later but it is on my list. Thanks for the great recipe.

This is THE recipe for homemade Italian Chicken Parm!! If you want a good restaurant-quality crisply breaded Italian dish this is the one!! Pay attention to the notes and follow them! This will be my go-to recipe when i'm in the mood for classic Italian Chicken Parmesan!!
Didn't have fresh basil. Used standard Italian seasoning instead. The chicken breading stayed crispy. Family enjoyed it.
Tender crispy perfection! I did not have any fresh basil, so I used pesto. Still tasted great!
so tasty & easy to make
A short cut I always use is to combine the eggs and 2 tablespoons of flour with a little water to dip cutlets in. Works just as well as flouring and dipping into eggs. Eliminates a bowl.
Easy to make, first time making chicken parm and it turned out great!!

We just got done eating this about 20 minutes ago, and it was FANTASTIC! I did have to make some alterations As I didn’t have a few of the actual listed ingredients. My subs were as follows: 1) I used a box of chicken flavored stuffing instead of Panko. I used our food ninja to make it into bread crumbs. (I was out of Panko.) 2) I didn’t have the Parmesan or the provalone cheeses but had a bag of “Italian cheese blend”. 3) I used a marinara sauce 4) I used “no yolk egg noodles. Overall, essentially the same types of ingredients, and it turned out so good that my boyfriend took one bite and his eyes were just BEAMING! He gave it a definite 2 thumbs up!!! Thank you for this recipe. I will definitely be adding it to our menu rotation! I we loved it!!!

Great, straightforward base recipe, however i added way more seasoning than just salt & pepper to taste. I seasoned the chicken with garlic salt, pepper, onion powder, dried basil and oregano; seasoned my flour with paprika, garlic. Used Rao’s brand sauce, and made a garlic bread from a fresh baguette. Delicious and my husband LOVED it.
Great recipe and fairly easy to make. I split the chicken breasts lengthwise to make them thinner and then pound to 1/4". A family favorite!

Great recipe and I was able to make it GF/DF and it was delicious!! Used 2 slices of Violife “mature cheddar” chopped very fine (so it would melt) for the provolone. Miyokos liquid mozzarella and Violife block “parm” grated for the 3/4 cup of parm. In order to make it all hold together on top of the chicken bread breading, I put the liquid miyokos, finely chopped violife slices together in a bowl along with some dried basil, as I did not have fresh, mixed it all together and then spooned that on the breasts and sprinkled some Violife faux parm right before putting them in the oven. I also used GF bread crumbs. This is a keeper in our family.
It was a pretty awesome dish, followed it to the letter
This is a great Chicken Parmesan recipe!!
Easy, quick and delicious

This was my first time making this dish my daughter has begged me for months and this recipe hit it out of the park home run. So easy I'm making it again tonight less than two weeks ago was the first time I made it. Ty
This is the BEST Chicken Parmesan I have personally ever had. Super easy to make. DELICIOUS !!

I love chicken parm but I don’t bread or fry the chicken. I do pound and marinated the chicken. Then I will throw it on the bbq grill. When it reaches 165* I then put on the sauce and cheese. Once the cheese melt's it’s served. This cuts down on a few calories and tastes great!
Fantastic!!! I don't eat chicken so I used boneless turkey breasts. No other changes. Labor intensive for me but worth while.

Recipe is very generic and boring. Baking the chicken isn't optimal. Way better to fry the chicken in the oil; add the cheese right after (one slice vs cubes). Better to have the sauce on the side to dip the bites of chicken you cut for the most optimal texture and flavor.
I would give this 6 stars if I could. It was so good! The whole family loved it. I used gluten free panko crumbs and almond flour instead of regular flour.
Love this recipe! Instead of frying the chicken in a pan with oil, I air fry them for extra crunch and less oil. Delicious every time.
Followed the recipe exactly from the video - AND made Eggplant Parm using exact same process. It was just fabulous ! Now to clean up the mess !!
This is by far the BEST EVER Ckn Parm recipe! Chef John’s tip in this recipe knocked it out of the park!!!

Loved this recipe! I gave it 4 stars because of the cooking temperature. I baked mine at 375. I was nervous because of the negative reviews, which stated that the chicken was bland. However, during the recipe description it stated to season the chicken well. I did my thing, seasoned the chicken and everything came out SOOOO delicious! TY Chef John.
Best chicken parm Eva!!
Letting the breaded chicken rest is brilliant. This was easy and delish!
Best chicken parmesan I have ever made. Thank you!
Making it for the third time tonight. I don’t change anything and as usual Chef J nails it. Excellent recipe
Great recipe followed it exactly and my husband said it was the best chicken I’ve cooked to date! Very juicy and letting it sit with the better before frying really made the coat stick nicely.
Ultimately it turned out great and the whole family loved it. Make sure to double check the measurements in the instructions, not all will update when the servings are adjusted but is an easy catch.
Amazing. I loved how it was so easy to follow!!!!!

Easy, great recipe!!!! I opted to “cheat” on the sauce and used a jar variety of Bertolli brand. I did run short on enough Panko, so I added Italian Herb breadcrumbs and it turn out great. I sautéed some onions, bell and sweet peppers as a topper to a side of pasta. Soooo good!!!
Excellent! Loved the supportive reviews , made this recipe extra special, thank you!
Very good will make again the exact way
Great! Love It.
This is my go to recipe! Perfectly moist and tasty every time! Love it.

This was easier than I thought and tasted wonderful! I warmed some extra sauce and served it, along with extra grated parmigiana and provolone cheeses, table side. Personally, I didn’t think it needed anything extra! In fact, I planned to serve it with some spaghetti noodles but ran out of time and left it off. we all thought it was great with a side of fresh baked bread—a baguette with butter and garlic. A salad would have complimented nicely. Thanks for a wonderful recipe!
no changes..perfect the way it is!
Made it exactly as the directions said too. This was the juiciest parmigiana chicken I have ever had. It was flavorful and absolutely delicious. The entire family loved I will be making this again.
Followed to the letter and it was very good. however the cheese slid off the chicken Next time ill put the cheese on, bake then add the sauce.
Easy recipe with excellent results. i used my resources so i didn’t use Panko, instead a regular Italian breadcrumbs but it still came out super crispy.
The whole family loved the chicken. It was breaded nicely and the 2 tablespoons of sauce was plenty. I will be keeping this recipe handy.
This is the second time I’ve made this and it is a great recipe. I don’t like cooking at all but I got through this recipe-thanks!
It was so good. There are a couple of steps I didn’t do or substituted items. I had five breasts so I had to squeeze one in the middle.
I give this five stars not just because the recipe was so delicious (and it was), but because the video and explanations made it so straightforward and easy to follow. Huge success!
LOVED IT THANK YOU
Baking the cutlet at 450 degrees for 20 minutes will result in the cheese totally burnt to a dark brown. Better at 350-375 degrees.

This was absolutely delicious. It tasted better than restaurant quality. I added garlic powder, and basil seasoning to the Italian bread crumbs, herbs, and parmesan mixture. The chicken was well seasoned and moist, and tender. I also used discs of fresh mozzarella rather than cutting them up, and slices of Provolone (rather than shredded). It was absolutely delicious (I can't say that enough!) Will definitely make this again.

I have tried other chicken parm recipes and this one is, by far, going into our family dinner rotation. What differentiated this recipe from some others is: a.) adding parmesan to the breadcrumbs and b.) the addition of provolone to the mozzarella topping. The slight modifications I made were: a.) seasoning the chicken with garlic powder and b.) adding Italian seasoned breadcrumbs to the panko/parm mixture. I used our favorite jarred Marinara.

It led me in the right direction for such a classic. One difference I used a cast iron skillet and once chicken was seared on the stove transferred directly in the oven after the sauce and cheeses were put on. I also like a side of noodles and sauce with my chicken parm.
Didn’t have provolone so used Asiago instead, hubby looooved it! Making it again soon ✨✨✨
It was delicious! I appreciated the tips given, particularly less sauce so that the chicken stays crispy. It turned out perfect! Thank you
Great!
This picture was before baking !! The recipe was so easy !! Can’t wait to taste !!!! Denise Robinson
I used Italian seasoning instead of basil. Tasted great!
